prime.gui.behaviours.drag.DragInfo

type
class
implements
prime.core.traits.IDisposable
available in
swf
DragInfo contains all the information about an object that is currenly dragged.

Constructor

new(target : prime.gui.display.ISprite, ?dataCursor : prime.bindable.collections.IDataCursor<Dynamic>, ?dragRenderer : prime.gui.display.ISprite, ?dragLayout : prime.layout.LayoutClient)

Instance Variables

dataCursor(default,null) : prime.bindable.collections.IDataCursor<Dynamic>

Optional cursor pointer for the data

displayCursor(default,null) : prime.gui.display.DisplayDataCursor

Information about the displayList in which the target is placed.

dragRectangle(default,null) : prime.core.geom.IRectangle

Rectangle indicating the boundaries of the dragged object in the global coordinate-space. x-y coordinates won't update automaticly unless the ShowDragGapBehaviour is used.

dragRenderer(default,null) : prime.gui.display.ISprite

Sprite to visualize the dragged-item during a drag operation.

dropBounds : prime.core.geom.IRectangle

Location on which the item is dropped. Location is already converted to the coordinates of the dropTarget.

dropTarget(default,accessor) : prime.gui.traits.IDropTarget

The current dropTarget. Property will only be set if it allows the target as a ISprite. In flash the dropTarget is defined by the FlashPlayer, which will return the first displayObject that's underneath the mouse (without looking at the boundaries of the dragged-item or if the displayObject has mouseEnabled or mouseChildren enabled).

layout(default,null) : prime.layout.LayoutClient

Layout object of the target

target(default,null) : prime.gui.display.ISprite

Instance Methods

dispose() : Void

inline restore() : Void
